clauses.title: Tracking via third-party cookies for purposes including advertising
clauses.description: The service's website sets third-party cookies (cookies that do not belong to their domain) for purposes not including statistics and analytics.
clauses.clause_text: We and our advertising partners use these cookies to deliver advertisements, to make them more relevant and meaningful to visitors to our website, and to track the efficiency of our advertising campaigns.

case.text: Third-party cookies are used for advertising

clauses.title: This service may keep personal data after a request for erasure for business interests or legal obligations
clauses.description: After the end of the data retention period and/or if you request the deletion of your data, they may still keep it for business interests (fraud detection, transactions...) or legal obligations (tax, legal reporting...)
clauses.clause_text: You may delete your account or terminate your subscription pursuant to Flickr’s Terms of Use, but note that we may retain certain information as required by law or for legitimate business purposes.

case.text: Some personal data may be kept for business interests or legal obligations

clauses.title: The service may sell your data unless you opt out
clauses.description: There is a form to opt-out (typically California's CCPA) of the selling of your personal data. This is a bad a point because there are many services that don't have this form due to not selling your data in the first place.
clauses.clause_text:
The CCPA requires businesses that “sell” personal information, as the term “sell” is defined under the CCPA, to provide an opt-out from such “sales.” Some people have taken the position that when a website or app uses third-party cookies and similar technology for its own analytics or advertising purposes, the website/app is engaged in a “sale” under the CCPA if the third parties have some ability to use, disclose or retain the data to improve their service or to take steps beyond the most narrowly drawn bounds of merely providing their service to the website/app.
Some take this position even when the website/app pays the third party (not vice versa), and in most cases merely provides the third party with an opportunity to collect data directly, instead of sending a copy of personal information to the third party.
If you take the position that any of those relationships involve a “sale” within the meaning of the CCPA, then you may consider Flickr to have “sold” what the CCPA calls “identifiers” (like IP addresses), “internet or other electronic network activity information” (like information regarding an individual’s browsing interactions on Flickr.com), and “commercial information” (like the fact that a browser visited a particular page on our website) to those sorts of companies.

case.text: Your Personal data may be sold unless you opt out

clauses.title: This service tracks you on other websites
clauses.description: The service may use tracking technologies in third-party websites to track your online activity while you aren't visiting their Site.
clauses.clause_text: These technologies can remember that your device has visited a site or service, and may also be able to track your device's browsing activity on other sites or services other than Flickr which also make use of the services of these third parties.

case.text: This service tracks you on other websites

clauses.title: Instead of asking directly, this Service will assume your consent merely from your usage.
clauses.description: The Service infers your acceptance from your continued usage, instead of prompting you to read the new Terms and asking for direct consent. This doesn’t apply to services that have no way to seek consent from users through their contact details or an account.
clauses.clause_text: Your use of the Services (such as through your purchase of any Products) or your purchase of new Services following the posting of the revised Terms of Use or other notice will constitute your acceptance of such changes or modifications.

case.text: Instead of asking directly, this Service will assume your consent to changes of terms merely from your usage.

clauses.title: This service reserves the right to disclose your personal information without notifying you
clauses.description: If the Government governing the Terms requests personal data of a user of this service, they may not inform/notify the user while complying with the request.
clauses.clause_text: In the absence of a legal requirement to do so, Flickr may refrain from notifying you of Flickr’s disclosures to governmental authorities where such notification may jeopardize an important law enforcement investigation.

case.text: Your personal data may be disclosed to comply with government requests without notice to you

clauses.title: This service forces users into binding arbitration in the case of disputes
clauses.description: This service forces users to use their own contracted arbitrator and forces users to waive their rights to jury trial.
clauses.clause_text:
On 2024-10-20 06:29:30 UTC, fedada (30172)  Suspended wrote:
          The recommendations for books and movies on 즐달 are fantastic. 즐달

case.text: You are forced into binding arbitration in case of disputes

clauses.title: You waive your right to a class action.
clauses.description: The right to be represented in a class action (or representative action) exists in the US and some European countries. It allows people who have been similarly injured by the same accused to take legal action by a single lawsuit instead of individually. Some Terms of Service try to limit that right. By agreeing to them, you could waive (= renounce to) your right to a class action, which might reduce your chances to be successful in a case.
clauses.clause_text: YOU AND SMUGMUG AGREE THAT EACH OF US MAY BRING CLAIMS AGAINST THE OTHER ONLY ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS AND NOT AS PART OF ANY PURPORTED CLASS OR REPRESENTATIVE ACTION OR PROCEEDING.

case.text: You waive your right to a class action.

clauses.title: This service tracks which web page referred you to it
clauses.description: The service logs the URL of the last web page you visited before visiting the Site and may use that information to gather more data about you.
clauses.clause_text: We log information about your use of the Services, including the type of browser you use, access times, pages viewed, your IP address and the page you visited before navigating to our Services

case.text: This service tracks which web page referred you to it

clauses.title: This service gathers information about you through third parties
clauses.description: This Service may employ, either identifiable or non-identifiable, data collection from third party sources about you.
clauses.clause_text: We may also obtain information from other sources and combine that with information we collect through our Services. For example, if you create or log into your account through a social media site, we will have access to certain information from that site, such as your name, account information and friends lists, in accordance with the authorization procedures determined by such social media site. We may receive updated information about you, such as an updated billing address, from the financial institution issuing your credit card in connection with our billing for the Services.

case.text: Information is gathered about you through third parties

clauses.title: This service can license user content to third parties
clauses.description: By posting content through the Services, users grant them a transferable and/or sublicensable right, which allows user content to be licensed to third parties.
clauses.clause_text: Full quote: "You hereby grant SmugMug a royalty-free, sublicensable, transferable, perpetual, irrevocable license in and to any feedback to use in any matter related to the operation of our business."

case.text: Your content can be licensed to third parties

clauses.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.
clauses.description: Tracking technologies (such as web beacons, tracking pixels...) are employed on users and/or the service assigns a unique ID to a browser or device to track its behaviour.
clauses.clause_text: We use various technologies to collect information, including cookies, web beacons and similar technologies.

case.text: You are tracked via web beacons, tracking pixels, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting

clauses.title: The service may collect extra data about you through promotions
clauses.description: Additional personal data may be collected through contests, surveys, promotions, petitions or sweepstakes.
clauses.clause_text: "Collection of Information Information You Provide to Us We collect information you provide directly to us. For example, we collect information when you:[...] Participate in a survey, contest or sweepstakes;"

case.text: Extra data may be collected about you through promotions

clauses.title: This service keeps a license on user-generated content even after users close their accounts.
clauses.description: The service may still use your content and display it after you stopped using it by closing your account. The case applies to terms requiring users to grant them a perpetual license over that content.
clauses.clause_text: Full quote: "You hereby grant SmugMug a royalty-free, sublicensable, transferable, perpetual, irrevocable license in and to any feedback to use in any matter related to the operation of our business."

case.text: A license is kept on user-generated content even after you close your account

clauses.title: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.
clauses.description: If the service gets acquired or is involved in a merger, bankruptcy, reorganisation or sale, your personal data may be transferred or sold.
clauses.clause_text: "We may share information about you as follows or as otherwise described in this Privacy Policy:[...]In connection with, or in anticipation of, any merger, divestiture, consolidation, bankruptcy, sale of company assets, financing or acquisition of all or a portion of our business to another company, or other significant corporate event (in which case the acquiring entity may use the information pursuant to its own privacy policies and procedures, to the extent legally permissible)."

case.text: Your personal data may be sold or otherwise transferred as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction

clauses.title: This service uses third-party cookies for statistics
clauses.description: For instance, Google Analytics, rather than self-hosted (first-party) statistics software.
clauses.clause_text: Third-party cookies may be placed on your device by someone providing a service for Flickr, for example to help us understand how our service is being used.

case.text: Third-party cookies are used for statistics

clauses.title: The court of law governing the terms is in a jurisdiction that is friendlier to user privacy protection (California, USA)
clauses.description: The Terms are governed by the applicable laws of a jurisdiction known for protecting citizens privacy with strong data regulations. Usually contributors will need to explain in the Analysis view of each point linked to this Case why the jurisdiction is friendly to user privacy protection.
clauses.clause_text:

case.text: The court of law governing the terms is in a jurisdiction that is friendlier to user privacy protection.

clauses.title: When the service wants to make a material change to its terms, users are notified at least 30 days in advance
clauses.description: The service may update the Terms without notice, but if they significantly change the agreements in a manner that importantly and/or negatively affects the way the service is used, users will be notified at least 30 days in advance.
clauses.clause_text:
Terms of Use or other notice will constitute your acceptance of such changes or modifications.
Otherwise, any changes or modifications will be effective within thirty (30) days of the posting of the revisions on the Site unless you notify SmugMug within such thirty (30) days that you do not agree to the changes and stop using the Services.

case.text: When the service wants to make a material change to its terms, you are notified at least 30 days in advance

clauses.title: This service allows you to retrieve an archive of your data
clauses.description: Users can request a copy of the data collected through the services and infer from it the amount of personal information that is processed and stored by the Service. This usually applies to Services GDPR compliants.
clauses.clause_text: Provide access to and/or a copy of certain information we hold about you.

case.text: You can retrieve an archive of your data

clauses.title: The service reviews its privacy policy on a regular basis
clauses.description: Users know the date the privacy policy was last updated and can thus infer the next time it will be reviewed. This gives users more certainty about how long they can trust the current policy to apply.
clauses.clause_text: We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time. If we make changes, we will notify you by revising the date at the top of the policy and, if the changes are significant, we will provide you with additional notice (such as adding a statement to our homepage or sending you an email notification). We encourage you to review the Privacy Policy whenever you access the Services to stay informed about our information practices and the choices available to you.

case.text: The service reviews its privacy policy on a regular basis

clauses.title: You can opt out of targeted advertising
clauses.description: The service employs your data to target ads to you, but you can opt-out of this interest-based advertising.
clauses.clause_text: For information on how our advertising partners allow you to opt out of receiving ads based on your web browsing history, please visit http://optout.aboutads.info.

case.text: You can opt out of targeted advertising

clauses.title: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service
clauses.description: Most browsers allow users to set preferences related to cookies storage. You may choose to block all cookies (including first-party cookies), but it may impact your use of this service and you may not be able to access some or any of the features provided.
clauses.clause_text: Please be advised that if you set your browser to disable cookies or other technologies, you may not be able to access certain parts of our Service and other parts of our Service will not work properly.

case.text: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service

clauses.title: There is a date of the last update of the agreements
clauses.description: The given text has a date that allows to know when it was last updated.
clauses.clause_text:
Conditions of Use

Date of Last Revision: April 30, 2020

case.text: There is a date of the last update of the agreements

clauses.title: Invalidity of any portion of the Terms of Service does not entail invalidity of its remainder
clauses.description: Should any portion of the Terms of Service be unenforceable or invalid, that portion will be enforced to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law and the remainder of the TOS will remain valid and enforceable.
clauses.clause_text: If any portion of this statement is found to be unenforceable, the remaining portion will remain in full force and effect.

case.text: Invalidity of any portion of the Terms of Service does not entail invalidity of its remainder

clauses.title: Failure to enforce any provision of the Terms of Service does not constitute a waiver of such provision
clauses.description: Even if the service does not or not always enforce all of the rules or provisions contained in its terms, they still apply. Users can at a later time still be held accountable for violating provisions that have not been enforced consistently.
clauses.clause_text: SmugMug’s enforcement of the acceptable use provisions set forth in these Terms of Use with respect to User Content in some instances does not constitute a waiver of our right to enforce such provisions in other instances involving similar User Content.

case.text: Failure to enforce any provision of the Terms of Service does not constitute a waiver of such provision

clauses.title: The court of law governing the terms is State of California (U.S.)
clauses.description: The Terms are governed by the applicable laws of a jurisdiction (specified in the title of each point by replacing the "X").
